author: jwasinger
content:
<@&836981603216654336> I am looking into a consensus issue between geth/reth and besu on a local devnet.  The root cause appears to be that a call is made to `0x000...000` which doesn't have enough gas to cover the portion of the cost that doesn't depend on looking up the target account (memory gas cost + transfer cost + EIP 2929 cold access cost).

Reth/Geth go out of gas before reading the target account, but Besu does not.

I've posted the chain in the following google drive link.  The directory contains `genesis.json`, the block range where the clients stayed in sync (`blocks1-915.rlp`) and the block that broke consensus (`block916.rlp`).

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1LVHHkXvEVKbSvSkPfXT252fJ8Zt04TZi?usp=sharing

author: jwasinger
content: Geth *has* implemented the new call gas accounting.  However, to be sure that this consensus fault isn't somehow an issue with the BAL-friendly call gas accounting in geth/reth, I ran the transaction through the call gas accounting logic in the master branch and verified that the provided gas isn't sufficient to cover the portion that is required before proceeding and doing state lookups.
